poem:
### Chemical Cocktail 

In rooms where toxins trade, lobbyists 
weave their promises—sweet vapors waft  
over Senate floors, cloaking truths.  
Beneath the guise of safety masks,  
ink dries on policies that weigh  
the air, the water—our bodies.  
Yet, we sip the chemical cocktail,  
clinking glasses to invisible futures.
